title: IGLV9-NPLJ
text:
Allele Appearances
The plot visualizes the Frequencyand usage of alleles across a population as observed in both AIRR-seq and genomic data, focusing on alleles that meet strict criteria for inclusion in the genotype. Only sequences without mutations in the V region, with a single V allele assignment, and alignment starting at position one of the V germline were considered. For IGHD alleles, additional filtering ensured that sequences had no mutations in the D region and only one assigned D allele. Alleles were retained only if they had a z-score above 0, and for IGHD alleles, the median ratio of observed sequence length to allele length had to exceed 0.5. These stringent criteria ensured that the analysis included only reliable alleles.

Alleles were retained only if they had a z-score above 0, and for IGHD alleles, the median ratio of observed sequence length to allele length had to exceed 0.5. title: IGHV3-PSOC
text:
Allele Appearances
The plot visualizes the Frequencyand usage of alleles across a population as observed in both AIRR-seq and genomic data, focusing on alleles that meet strict criteria for inclusion in the genotype. Only sequences without mutations in the V region, with a single V allele assignment, and alignment starting at position one of the V germline were considered. For IGHD alleles, additional filtering ensured that sequences had no mutations in the D region and only one assigned D allele. Alleles were retained only if they had a z-score above 0, and for IGHD alleles, the median ratio of observed sequence length to allele length had to exceed 0.5. These stringent criteria ensured that the analysis included only reliable alleles.

title: Genotype inference
text:
For the genotype inference we applied a pre-genotype filter that required sequences to have no mutations within the V region, a single V allele assignment, and alignment starting from position one of the V germline. Only alleles having a threshold z Score above 0 were retained. For IGHD genotype inference, the selection was further refined by including only sequences with no mutations in the D region and a single assigned D allele. Additionally, the median ratio of sequence length observed in the repertoire to the allele length was calculated using sequences annotated with that specific IGHD allele from subjects carrying the allele in their genotype, considering only alleles where the ratio was above 0.5.
The Piglet allele-based method was used for genotype inference based on AIRR-seq data. It compares allele usage against a population-derived threshold to determine allele inclusion in the genotype. A z score is calculated for each allele, measuring its significance in the repertoire. The formula incorporates allele count, frequency threshold, and repertoire depth, with higher z scores indicating a stronger likelihood of allele presence in the genotype.
In a detailed analysis, it was found that of the 143 existing IGHV clusters, 143 are not represented in the genotypes of the 106 subjects analyzed. 1054 out of 1054 existing IGHV alleles were not found in the genotypes of the subjects.
There are 0 IGHV novel allele that were found in the genotypes of these 106 subjects.

Allele Appearances
The plot visualizes the Frequencyand usage of alleles across a population as observed in both AIRR-seq and genomic data, focusing on alleles that meet strict criteria for inclusion in the genotype. Only sequences without mutations in the V region, with a single V allele assignment, and alignment starting at position one of the V germline were considered. For IGHD alleles, additional filtering ensured that sequences had no mutations in the D region and only one assigned D allele. Alleles were retained only if they had a z-score above 0, and for IGHD alleles, the median ratio of observed sequence length to allele length had to exceed 0.5. These stringent criteria ensured that the analysis included only reliable alleles.

The plot visualizes the Frequencyand usage of alleles across a population as observed in both AIRR-seq and genomic data, focusing on alleles that meet strict criteria for inclusion in the genotype. Only sequences without mutations in the V region, with a single V allele assignment, and alignment starting at position one of the V germline were considered. For IGHD alleles, additional filtering ensured that sequences had no mutations in the D region and only one assigned D allele. Alleles were retained only if they had a z-score above 0, and for IGHD alleles, the median ratio of observed sequence length to allele length had to exceed 0.5. These stringent criteria ensured that the analysis included only reliable alleles.

The plot visualizes the Frequencyand usage of alleles across a population as observed in both AIRR-seq and genomic data, focusing on alleles that meet strict criteria for inclusion in the genotype. Only sequences without mutations in the V region, with a single V allele assignment, and alignment starting at position one of the V germline were considered. For IGHD alleles, additional filtering ensured that sequences had no mutations in the D region and only one assigned D allele. Alleles were retained only if they had a z-score above 0, and for IGHD alleles, the median ratio of observed sequence length to allele length had to exceed 0.5. These stringent criteria ensured that the analysis included only reliable alleles.
